text: We can examine the relationship between the dependent and independent variables. What information was easier to get from the table? From the graph? Explain why.

More useful may depend on whether you are trying to get specific information, such as how much it costs to rent 30 bikes or how many bikes you can rent for $100. To get a sense of how the data changes over time or over the number of bikes rented, graphs may be more useful. Later, students may say a table is useful for writing equations.

Studentsâ€™ opinion on which representation is the more useful will vary.

Table

Some students will like to know the data values given in the table. Other students will not like finding the patterns between the variables in the table representation.

Graph

Some students will like seeing the visual of the pattern between the variables on the graph. Other students will not like that you have to estimate values when the points do not land on the grid lines.
